result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Case called @ 10:34 AM Defendant Pam L Peters in court.  Attorney Emma K Blankschein in court for Pam L Peters.  Attorney Matthew R. Leusink in court for State of Wisconsin. Court addresses defense motion in limine and grants paragraphs 3, 4, 6, 8, 11 & 12, the Court does not make a ruling on the balance of the paragraphs at this time and will address at the trial. No objection by the State. Court addresses State motion in limine. No objection by Attorney Blankschein. Court grants State's motions in limine, paragraphs 1-9. The Court will address the jury instructions the day of trial. Court addresses 906.09 motion filed by the State. Statement by DA Leusink regarding the 906.09 motion. Statement by Attorney Blankschein - does voice an objection to convictions C-J. Court makes statement and instructs defendant regarding impeachment-answer is yes, and correct number is 13. The Court addresses the Motion to Admit Evidence of Acts of Co-Defendant. Argument by DA Leusink. Argument by Atty Blankschein. The Court denies the motion for reasons stated on the record. Both parties agree that one day is needed for trial. Court addresses trial logistics with counsel. 21 in box, 4 strikes.
Jury trial scheduled for March 23, 2023 at 08:00 am.
Jury trial on March 23, 2023 at 08:00 am.
